column3: There's a problem in the swamp. I'll need to study how it works, but it recognizes that the ball goes in, but then needs to be slammed before it kicks out

- On a 1-player game, it gives you 10 balls. And it won't start a two-player game unless you hold down the relay for longer than it would normally close. - The issue seems to be related to the second switch from the top on a relay with name something like "2nd player select", but that name doesn't appear on the circuit diagram. I tried cleaning it, without luck, and I also adjusted it to be tighter. But it'll work if I hold it closed while it's cycling.

column1: - I suspect something weird in the backbox, where the second-player state is represented. But I need a second person to fix it.

column3: Playing volume level erratic. When not playing, low crackles from speaker
